isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND ACCESSORIES - Tools and Accessories - Gauge Bar Tool

svcproc.title: Gauge Bar Tool
svcproc.para: The gauge bar tool is used to measure intake manifold (boost) pressure, fuel pressure, air cleaner intake restriction, fuel restriction, and crankcase pressure.

item.para: 0-200 kPa (0-30 psi) gauge No. 1 may be used to measure the intake manifold (boost) pressure.
Compound gauge No. 2 - 0-30 in Hg vacuum gauge/0-200 kPa (0-30 psi) gauge - may be used to measure the fuel system inlet restriction, fuel pressure or intake manifold (boost) pressure.
The 0-30 in H 2O (0-1.5 psi maximum pressure) magnehelic gauge may be used to measure the air cleaner restriction or crankcase pressure.
When using the magnehelic gauge, plug the test line into the correct port. Use the VACUUM port (No. 3) to read air cleaner restriction. Use the PRESSURE port (No. 4) to read crankcase pressure.
0-200 kPa (0-30 psi) gauge No. 5 may be used to check the fuel pressure.
0-1100 kPa (0-160 psi) gauge No. 6 with a built in regulator may be used to check the movement of a waste gate actuator.

svcproc.para: Connect test lines between the gauge ports on the gauge bar and the test points shown on the rear side of the Hard Start and No Start Diagnostic Form (EGED-245) or the Performance Diagnostic Form (EGED-250).
